1.en: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.

2.en: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows.

3.en: BULBASAUR can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

4.en: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

5.en: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

6.en: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.
6.ja: 生まれたときから　背中に 不思議な　タネが　植えてあって 体と　ともに　育つという。

7.en: It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.
7.ja: 何日だって　なにも　食べなくても 元気！　背中のタネに　たくさん 栄養が　あるから　平気だ！

8.en: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
8.ja: 生まれたときから　背中に 植物の　タネが　あって 少しずつ　大きく　育つ。

1.en: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

2.en: Exposure to sun­ light adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

3.en: There is a bud on this POKéMON’s back. To support its weight, IVYSAUR’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

4.en: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.

5.en: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.

6.en: There is a plant bulb on its back. When it absorbs nutrients, the bulb is said to blossom into a large flower.
6.ja: つぼみが　背中に　ついていて 養分を　吸収していくと 大きな　花が　咲くという。

7.en: The bud on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.
7.ja: 養分を　摂って　大きくなった つぼみから　香りが　漂いだすと もうすぐ　ハナが開く　証拠だ。

8.en: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
8.ja: 背中の　つぼみが　大きく 育ってくると　２本脚で 立つことが　できなくなるらしい。

1.en: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

2.en: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.

3.en: There is a large flower on VENUSAUR’s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.

4.en: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

5.en: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

6.en: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun’s rays, it fills its body with power.
6.ja: 大きな　花びらを　広げ 太陽の　光を　浴びていると 体に　元気が　みなぎっていく。

7.en: The flower on its back catches the sun’s rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy.
7.ja: 背中に　生えた　大きな　ハナは 太陽の　光を　吸収し エネルギーに　変換　できる。

8.en: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
8.ja: 太陽エネルギーを　栄養にして 大きな花が　開く。　日なたに 引き寄せられるように　移動する。

1.en: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

2.en: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.

3.en: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when CHARMANDER is enjoying itself. If the POKéMON becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

4.en: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

5.en: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

6.en: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander’s life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.
6.ja: 尻尾の　炎は ヒトカゲの　生命力の　証。 元気だと　さかんに　燃えさかる。

7.en: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
7.ja: 静かな　ところに　連れていくと シッポが　燃えてる　小さな　音が 聞こえてくるよ。

8.en: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
8.ja: 熱いものを　好む　性格。 雨に濡れると　しっぽの　先から 煙が　出るという。

1.en: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

2.en: It is very hot­ headed by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins.

3.en: CHARMELEON mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.

4.en: In the rocky mountains where CHARMELEON live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

5.en: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

6.en: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.
6.ja: 尻尾を　振り回して 相手を　なぎ倒し　鋭い　ツメで ズタズタに　ひきさいてしまう。

7.en: Tough fights could excite this Pokémon. When excited, it may breathe out bluish-white flames.
7.ja: 強敵と　戦いつづけ エキサイトすると　青白い 炎を　吐き出すことがある。

8.en: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
8.ja: 燃える　しっぽを　振りまわし するどい　ツメで　相手を 切り裂く　荒々しい　性格。

1.en: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

2.en: If CHARIZARD be­ comes furious, the flame at the tip of its tail flares up in a whitish- blue color.

3.en: CHARIZARD flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

4.en: It is said that CHARIZARD’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

5.en: It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

6.en: When expelling a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
6.ja: 口から　灼熱の　炎を　吐き出すとき 尻尾の　先は より　赤く　激しく　燃え上がる。

7.en: When this Pokémon expels a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
7.ja: 口から　灼熱の　炎を 吐き出すとき　シッポの先は より　赤く　激しく　燃えあがる。

8.en: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
8.ja: 岩石も　焼けるような 灼熱の　炎を　吐いて 山火事を　起こすことが　ある。

1.en: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

2.en: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prod­ ding fingers will bounce off it.

3.en: SQUIRTLE’s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this POKéMON to swim at high speeds.

4.en: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

5.en: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

6.en: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
6.ja: 甲羅に　閉じこもり　身を　守る。 相手の　すきを　見逃さず 水を　噴き出して　反撃する。

7.en: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
7.ja: 水面から　水を　噴射して エサをとる。危なくなると　こうらに 手足を　引っこめて　身を守る。

8.en: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
8.ja: 長い　首を　甲羅のなかに 引っこめるとき　勢いよく 水鉄砲を　発射する。

1.en: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

2.en: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that WARTORTLE is very old.

3.en: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as WARTORTLE ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this POKéMON’s toughness as a battler.

4.en: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

5.en: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

6.en: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
6.ja: ポカンと　頭を　たたかれるとき 甲羅に　引っこんで　避ける。でも ちょっとだけ　尻尾が　出ているよ。

7.en: When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
7.ja: ポカンと　頭を　たたかれるとき こうらに　引っこんで　よける。でも ちょっとだけ　シッポが　出ているよ。

8.en: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
8.ja: 長生きの　シンボルと　されている。 甲羅に　苔が　ついているのは とくに　長生きの　カメールだ。

1.en: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.

2.en: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can with­ stand the recoil of the water jets it fires.

3.en: BLASTOISE has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

4.en: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

5.en: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

6.en: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
6.ja: 体が　重たく　のしかかって 相手を　気絶させる。 ピンチのときは　殻に　隠れる。

7.en: Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.
7.ja: 相手に　狙いを　定めると 消防車の　ホースより 強い　勢いで　水を　出す。

8.en: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
8.ja: 体が　重たく　のしかかって 相手を　気絶させる。 ピンチの　ときは　殻に　隠れる。

1.en: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

2.en: For protection, it releases a horri­ ble stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

3.en: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

4.en: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

5.en: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

6.en: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.
6.ja: 頭の　触覚から 強烈な　においを　出して 敵を　追い払い　身を守る。

7.en: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
7.ja: とりポケモンに　襲われると　ツノから 臭いを　だして　抵抗　するが 餌食に　なることも　多い。

8.en: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
8.ja: 頭の　触角から 強烈な　においを　だして 敵を　追いはらい　身を守る。

1.en: This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

2.en: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it pre­ pares to evolve. It stays motion­ less in the shell.

3.en: The shell covering this POKéMON’s body is as hard as an iron slab. METAPOD does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.

4.en: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

5.en: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

6.en: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
6.ja: 鋼鉄のように　硬い　殻で やわらかい　中身を　守っている。 進化するまで　じっと　耐えている。

7.en: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn’t move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.
7.ja: カラの中には　トロトロの　中身が 詰まっている。　ほぼ動かないのは ウッカリ　中身が　こぼれないため。

8.en: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
8.ja: 進化を　待っている　状態。 硬くなる　ことしか　できないので 襲われないよう　じっとしている。

1.en: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

2.en: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

3.en: BUTTERFREE has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.

4.en: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

5.en: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

6.en: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
6.ja: 花の　ミツが　大好物。 わずかな　花粉で　花畑の 場所を　探し出すことが　できる。

7.en: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.
7.ja: 大きな　眼を　よく　観察すると 実は　小さな　眼が　無数に 集まって　できているのが　わかる。

8.en: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
8.ja: こまかく　速く　羽ばたいたら 猛毒の　りんぷんが 風に　のって　飛んでくるぞ。

1.en: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

2.en: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

3.en: WEEDLE has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).

4.en: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

5.en: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

6.en: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.
6.ja: 森や　草地に　多く　生息。 頭の　先に　５センチぐらいの 小さく　鋭い　毒針を持つ。

7.en: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
7.ja: 頭に　鋭い　ハリを　もつ。 森や　草地の　茂みに　隠れ ひたすら　ハッパを　食べている。

1.en: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

2.en: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.

3.en: KAKUNA remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.

4.en: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

5.en: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

6.en: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.
6.ja: 自分では　ほとんど　動けないが 危ないときは　硬くなって 身を守っているようだ。

7.en: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
7.ja: 自分では　ほとんど　動けないが 危なくなると　ハリを出して 毒を　与えることも　あるらしい。

1.en: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

2.en: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poi­ son stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.

3.en: BEEDRILL is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest - this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

4.en: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

5.en: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

6.en: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
6.ja: 両手と　お尻にある　３本の　毒針で 相手を　刺して　刺して 刺しまくって　攻撃する。

7.en: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
7.ja: 両手と　お尻にある　３本の 毒バリで　相手を　刺して 刺して　刺しまくって　攻撃する。

1.en: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

2.en: It usually hides in tall grass. Be­ cause it dislikes fighting, it pro­ tects itself by kicking up sand.

3.en: PIDGEY has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

4.en: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

5.en: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

6.en: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
6.ja: 森や　林に　多く　分布。 地上でも　激しく　はばたいて 砂を　かけたりする。

7.en: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
7.ja: おとなしい　性格で　襲われても 反撃　せずに　砂を　かけて 身を　守ることが　多い。

1.en: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.

2.en: It has outstanding vision. However high it flies, it is able to distin­ guish the move­ ments of its prey.

3.en: PIDGEOTTO claims a large area as its own territory. This POKéMON flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

4.en: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

5.en: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

6.en: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.
6.ja: 足の　ツメが　発達している。 エサの　タマタマを　つかんで １００キロ先の　巣まで　運ぶ。

7.en: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
7.ja: あり余る　体力の　持ち主で 広い　縄張りを　飛びまわり 遠くまで　エサを　探しにいく。

1.en: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.

2.en: Its well-developed chest muscles make it strong enough to whip up a gusty windstorm with just a few flaps.

3.en: This POKéMON has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many TRAINERS are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose PIDGEOT as their POKéMON.

4.en: By flapping its wings with all its might, PIDGEOT can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

5.en: By flapping its wings with all its might, Pidgeot can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

6.en: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
6.ja: エサを　探すとき　水面　すれすれを 滑るように　飛んで コイキングなどを　わしづかみにする。

7.en: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
7.ja: マッハ２で　飛行し　エサを探す。 その　大きな　ツメは　武器と しても　恐れられている。

1.en: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

2.en: It eats anything. Wherever food is available, it will settle down and produce offspring continuously.

3.en: RATTATA is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives - it will make its nest anywhere.

4.en: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

5.en: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

6.en: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.
6.ja: 食べるものが　あるところなら どこにだって　生息する。 １日中　エサを　探している。

7.en: Its incisors continue growing until its death. If its Trainer doesn’t offer it a file to gnaw on, it will gnaw on door frames, table legs, and so on.
7.ja: 前歯は　死ぬまで　伸び続けるので メンテナンスが　必要。　ヤスリを 用意しないと　柱を　かじられる。

1.en: It uses its whis­ kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.

2.en: Gnaws on anything with its tough fangs. It can even topple concrete buildings by gnaw­ ing on them.

3.en: RATICATE’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.

4.en: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

5.en: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

6.en: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
6.ja: 伸び続ける　前歯を　削るため 硬い　ものを　かじる　習性。 ブロック塀も　かじって　壊す。

7.en: Its hind feet are webbed, so it’s a strong swimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes even oceans.
7.ja: 泳ぐのが　得意。　後ろ足に 小さな　水かきが　ついていて 河や　ときに　海を　渡ることも。

1.en: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

2.en: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak.

3.en: SPEAROW has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.

4.en: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

5.en: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

6.en: Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed.
6.ja: 自分の　テリトリーを　守るため 短い　羽を　はばたかせて 忙しく　飛び回っている。

7.en: Its short wings make it inept at flying. It moves about hurriedly and pecks at Bug-type Pokémon in the tall grass.
7.ja: ハネが　短く　飛ぶのは　やや苦手。 せわしなく　動き回り　草むらの むしポケモンを　ついばんでいる。

1.en: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

2.en: It shoots itself suddenly high into the sky, then plummets down in one fell swoop to strike its prey.

3.en: FEAROW is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.

4.en: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

5.en: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

6.en: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.
6.ja: 大きな　翼で　大空を 飛び続けることが　できる。 １回も　降りなくても　平気だ。

7.en: It’s tough and has excellent stamina. It has no problem flying continuously for a whole day carrying a heavy load.
7.ja: タフで　持久力に　優れる。 重たい　荷物を　乗せたまま 丸１日　飛び続けても　平気。

1.en: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

2.en: It can freely de­ tach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can be­ come too heavy to move, however.

3.en: EKANS curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.

4.en: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

5.en: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

6.en: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
6.ja: 育つほどに　どんどん　長くなる。 そして　夜中は　木の枝に グルグルと　絡まって　休む。

7.en: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.
7.ja: 顎を　外すことで　自分より 大きな　獲物も　丸呑みに　する。 食後は　身体を　丸め　休む。

1.en: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

2.en: Transfixing prey with the face-like pattern on its belly, it binds and poisons the frightened victim.

3.en: This POKéMON is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once ARBOK wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.

4.en: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.

5.en: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.

6.en: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.
6.ja: お腹の　模様が　怖い　顔に　見える。 弱い　敵は　その模様を 見ただけで　逃げ出してしまう。

7.en: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.
7.ja: 最新の　研究で　お腹の 模様は　２０種類　以上の パターンが　あることが　判明。

1.en: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

2.en: This intelligent POKéMON roasts hard BERRIES with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.

3.en: Whenever PIKACHU comes across something new, it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry, it’s evidence that this POKéMON mistook the intensity of its charge.

4.en: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.

5.en: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

6.en: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
6.ja: 尻尾を　立てて　まわりの　様子を 探っていると　ときどき 雷が　尻尾に　落ちてくる。

7.en: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
7.ja: たくさんの　ピカチュウを　集め 発電所を　造る　計画が 最近　発表　された。

8.en: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
8.ja: つくる　電気が　強力な ピカチュウほど　ほっぺの　袋は 軟らかく　よく　伸びるぞ。

1.en: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

2.en: When its electric­ ity builds, its muscles are stimu­ lated, and it be­ comes more aggres­ sive than usual.

3.en: If the electrical sacks become excessively charged, RAICHU plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this POKéMON’s nest.

4.en: It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.

5.en: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

6.en: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
6.ja: 電気が　たまってくると 筋肉が　刺激され いつもより　攻撃的に　なってしまう。

7.en: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.
7.ja: 電撃は　１０万ボルトに 達することもあり　ヘタに触ると インド象でも　気絶する。

8.en: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
8.ja: 長い　しっぽが　アースになって 身を　守るため　自分自身は 高電圧にも　痺れないのだ。

1.en: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

2.en: If it fell from a great height, this POKéMON could save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.

3.en: SANDSHREW’s body is configured to absorb water without waste, enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This POKéMON curls up to protect itself from its enemies.

4.en: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

5.en: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

6.en: It burrows and lives underground. If threatened, it curls itself up into a ball for protection.
6.ja: 地面に　穴を　掘って　住む。 自分に　危険が　迫ると まるくなって　身を　守る。

7.en: It can roll its body into a ball. It moves through the desert by rolling at high speeds.
7.ja: 身体を　丸めて　ボールのような 姿に　なれる。　転がりながら 砂漠を　高速で　移動する。

8.en: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
8.ja: 乾燥した　砂地で　砂浴びを するのが　好き。　体に　ついた 汚れと　水気を　落とすのだ。

1.en: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

2.en: In an attempt to hide itself, it will run around at top speed to kick up a blinding dust storm.

3.en: SANDSLASH’s body is covered by tough spikes, which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones.

4.en: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

5.en: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

6.en: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spikes and claws. They grow back in a day.
6.ja: すごい　勢いで　地面を掘ると トゲや　ツメが　折れてしまうが 次の日には　生えそろっている。

7.en: Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes often break off. They grow back the next day, so it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
7.ja: 鋭いが　やや　もろい　ツメや トゲは　よく　折れる。　翌日には 生えそろうので　気に　しなくてよい。

8.en: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.
8.ja: 湿度が　低い　土地で　暮らす サンドパンほど　背中の　棘の 手触りは　硬く　滑らかになる。

1.en: Although small, its venomous barbs render this POKéMON dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

2.en: The poison hidden in its small horn is extremely po­ tent. Even a tiny scratch can have fatal results.

3.en: NIDORAN has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied POKéMON. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.

4.en: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from barbs can be fatal.

5.en: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from barbs can be fatal.

6.en: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
6.ja: 体は　小さくても　毒針を 持つため　注意が　必要だ。 メスのほうが　ツノが　小さい。

7.en: A mild-mannered Pokémon that does not like to fight. Beware—its small horn secretes venom.
7.ja: 優しい　性格で　戦いは 好まないが　小さな　ツノからは 毒が　でるので　要注意。

8.en: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
8.ja: オスよりも　匂いに　敏感。 ヒゲで　風向きを　確認しながら 風下で　エサを　探すのだ。

1.en: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

2.en: When feeding its young, it first chews and tender­ izes the food, then spits it out for the offspring.

3.en: When NIDORINA are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This POKéMON appears to become nervous if separated from the others.

4.en: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than NIDORINO’s.

5.en: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino’s.

6.en: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.
6.ja: メスなので　性格は　温厚。 口から　出す　超音波は 相手を　まどわす　力がある。

7.en: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
7.ja: 巣穴の　奥に　いるときは 必ず　トゲトゲが　引っこむ。 リラックスしている　証拠だ。

8.en: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.
8.ja: 額の　ツノは　子どもに　エサを 与えるときに　刺さらないよう 退化したと　考えられている。

1.en: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

2.en: Its body is cover­ ed with needle- like scales. It never shows signs of shrinking from any attack.

3.en: NIDOQUEEN’s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This POKéMON is at its strongest when it is defending its young.

4.en: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

5.en: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

6.en: It uses its scaly, rugged body to seal the entrance of its nest and protect its young from predators.
6.ja: ウロコで　覆われた　頑丈な　体で 巣穴の　入り口を　ふさぎ 敵から　子供たちを　守る。

7.en: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.
7.ja: 硬い　ウロコに　覆われた 頑丈な　体の　持ち主。 ウロコは　生え変わるらしい。

8.en: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.
8.ja: 攻めるよりも　守るほうが　得意。 鎧のような　ウロコで　いかなる 攻撃からも　子どもを　守る。

1.en: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

2.en: It is small, but its horn is filled with poison. It charges then stabs with the horn to inject poison.

3.en: The male NIDORAN has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this POKéMON’s notice.

4.en: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

5.en: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

6.en: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.
6.ja: 草むらの　上に　耳だけ　出して まわりの　気配を　探る。 猛毒の　ツノで　身を　守る。

7.en: Its large ears are always kept upright. If it senses danger, it will attack with a poisonous sting.
7.ja: いつも　大きな　耳を　立てて まわりの　気配を　探る。危険を 感じたときは　どくバリを　使う。

8.en: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
8.ja: 額の　ツノには　猛毒がある。 警戒心が　強く　大きな　耳を つねに　そばだてている。

1.en: An aggressive POKéMON that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

2.en: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses any­ thing, it attacks immediately.

3.en: NIDORINO has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.

4.en: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

5.en: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

6.en: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.
6.ja: 発達した　耳を　立てて まわりの　気配を　探る。 なにかあると　すぐに　飛びかかる。

7.en: Its horn contains venom. If it stabs an enemy with the horn, the impact makes the poison leak out.
7.ja: 頭にある　ツノの　毒素は 突き刺したときの　衝撃で にじみ出る　仕組みだ。

8.en: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.
8.ja: ダイヤモンドより　硬い　ツノで 岩石を　砕いて　まわる。 つきのいしを　探しているのだ。

1.en: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.

2.en: It swings its big tail around during battle. If its foe flinches, it will charge with its sturdy body.

3.en: NIDOKING’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this POKéMON goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

4.en: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

5.en: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

6.en: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn, as it contains venom.
6.ja: 石のように　硬い　皮膚と 長く　伸びた　ツノが　特徴。 ツノには　毒も　あるので　注意。

7.en: Its steel-like hide adds to its powerful tackle. Its horns are so hard, they can pierce a diamond.
7.ja: 鋼のような　皮膚を　活かした たいあたりは　強力。 ツノは　ダイヤモンドも　突き刺す。

8.en: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
8.ja: 暴れると　手が　つけられなくなるが 長年　連れ添った　ニドクインの 前では　穏やかな　顔に　なる。

1.en: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

2.en: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

3.en: On every night of a full moon, groups of this POKéMON come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired CLEFAIRY return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.

4.en: Thought to live with others on quiet mountains, it is popular for its adorable nature.

5.en: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

6.en: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
6.ja: 満月の夜　ピッピが　集まって ダンスを　踊る様子を　見ると 幸せに　なれると　言われている。

7.en: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
7.ja: 愛くるしい　仕草と　姿で 老若男女　問わずに 人気だが　その数は　少ない。

8.en: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.
8.ja: 満月の夜　ピッピが　集まって ダンスを　踊るようすを　見ると しあわせに　なれると　言われている。

1.en: A timid fairy POKéMON that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

2.en: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

3.en: CLEFABLE moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.

4.en: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.

5.en: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.

6.en: Its hearing is so acute it can hear a pin drop over half a mile away. It lives on quiet mountains.
6.ja: １キロ先で　落ちた　針の　音も 聞き分ける　優れた　耳を　持つ。 静かな　山奥に　住んでいる。

7.en: They don’t like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
7.ja: 人前に　姿を　みせることを 好まない。　深い　山の　奥で 群れに　なって　ひっそり　暮らす。

8.en: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
8.ja: 妖精の　仲間で　めったに 人前に　出てこない。　気配を 感じて　すぐに　逃げてしまうようだ。

1.en: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

2.en: As it develops,  its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.

3.en: At the time of its birth, VULPIX has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this POKéMON receives plenty of love from its TRAINER. The six tails become magnificently curled.

4.en: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

5.en: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

6.en: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
6.ja: 生まれたとき　尻尾は　真っ白で １本しかない。育つと　やがて 先が　分かれて　尻尾が　増える。

7.en: Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very popular. As it grows, its tails split to form more tails.
7.ja: 毛並みや　シッポが　美しいので 大人気。　成長に　連れ シッポは　わかれて　増えていく。

8.en: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
8.ja: 子どもだが　６本の　しっぽが 美しい。　成長すると　さらに しっぽが　増える。

1.en: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

2.en: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystical power.

3.en: NINETALES casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe’s mind. This POKéMON is said to live for a thousand years.

4.en: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

5.en: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

6.en: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
6.ja: 黄金に　輝く　体毛と ９本の　長い　尻尾を　持つ。 １０００年は　生きると　言われる。

7.en: Legend has it that this mystical Pokémon was formed when nine saints coalesced into one.
7.ja: ９人の　聖者が　合体し キュウコンに　なったという　伝説も 残るほど　神秘に満ちた　ポケモン。

8.en: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
8.ja: しっぽの　１本　１本に 神通力が　込められている。 １０００年　生きると　言われる。

1.en: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

2.en: If it inflates to SING a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.

3.en: JIGGLYPUFF’s vocal chords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This POKéMON uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy.

4.en: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

5.en: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

6.en: It captivates foes with its huge, round eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing a soothing melody.
6.ja: まるくて　大きい　瞳で　誘いこみ 心地よい　歌を　歌い 相手を　眠らせる。

7.en: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, you’ll become sleepy right away.
7.ja: 大きく　お腹を　膨らませて 不思議な　メロディーを　歌う。 聞くと　すぐに　眠くなるぞ。

8.en: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
8.ja: 肺活量は　ポケモン界でも トップクラス。　相手が　眠るまで 子守唄を　歌いつづけるぞ。

1.en: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

2.en: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.

3.en: WIGGLYTUFF has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this POKéMON’s eyes, it is quickly washed away.

4.en: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

5.en: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

6.en: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won’t want to be separated.
6.ja: ２匹　寄り添いあうと　お互いの 毛皮が　気持ち良すぎて 離れられなく　なってしまう。

7.en: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
7.ja: ふわふわの　毛は　季節の　変わり目に 抜け落ちる。　それを　拾い集めて 紡いだ　毛糸は　高級品。

8.en: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
8.ja: 息を　吸えば　吸うほど　膨らむ。 不機嫌になると　体を　大きく 膨らませて　相手を　威圧する。

1.en: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

2.en: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its sur­ roundings.

3.en: ZUBAT remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned.

4.en: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.

5.en: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.

6.en: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
6.ja: 口から　出す　超音波で 両目が　なくても まわりの　障害物を　察知できる。

7.en: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.
7.ja: 昼間は　洞穴で　寝ている。 目が　ないので　超音波で 周りを　確認しながら　飛ぶ。

8.en: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
8.ja: 口から　出す　超音波で まわりの　様子を　探る。 狭い　洞窟も　器用に　飛びまわる。

1.en: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

2.en: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.

3.en: GOLBAT loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This POKéMON flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.

4.en: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.

5.en: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.

6.en: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
6.ja: かみついたら　最後。死ぬほど 血を　吸いまくるので　重たくなって 自分で　飛べなくなることもある。

7.en: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
7.ja: 太い　キバは　ストローのように 中が　空洞で　意外に　もろい。 血を　吸うのに　特化　したのだ。

8.en: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
8.ja: 生き物の　血液が　好物。 腹ペコの　仲間に　吸った　血を 分け与えることも　あるという。

1.en: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

2.en: Awakened by moon­ light, it roams  actively at night. In the day, it stays quietly underground.

3.en: During the daytime, ODDISH buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from  the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.

4.en: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

5.en: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

6.en: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
6.ja: 昼間は　太陽を　避けるため 冷たい　地面に　潜っている。 月の　光を　浴びて　育つ。

7.en: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
7.ja: ただの　草だと　思って 引き抜こうとすると　鳴き声がする。 なぜか　とても　恐ろしい気分。

8.en: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
8.ja: 月の光を　浴びて　動きだす。 夜のあいだに　タネを　あちこちに ばらまくため　歩きまわる。

1.en: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

2.en: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

3.en: GLOOM releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this POKéMON is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.

4.en: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

5.en: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

6.en: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
6.ja: 猛烈な　クサさ！　それなのに １０００人に　１人ぐらい これを　好んで　かぐ　人がいる。

7.en: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
7.ja: 猛烈な　クサさ！　それなのに １０００人に　１人ぐらい　これを 好んで　嗅ぐ人がいる。

8.en: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
8.ja: めしべが　放つ　とてつもなく 臭い　においは　２キロ先まで とどき　気を　失わせる。

1.en: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

2.en: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

3.en: VILEPLUME’s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That’s why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.

4.en: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

5.en: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

6.en: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
6.ja: 花びらが　大きいほど たくさん　花粉を　出すが 頭が　重たくて　疲れてしまうという。

7.en: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
7.ja: 毒の　花粉を　ふりまくために 大きな　はなびらを　揺らすと ものすごい　音も　響き渡る。

8.en: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
8.ja: 世界一　大きな　花びらは 歩くたびに　揺れて　大量の 毒花粉を　ばらまいてしまう。

1.en: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw­ ing nutrients from the bug host.

2.en: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.

3.en: PARAS has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from the BUG POKéMON host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.

4.en: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host PARAS.

5.en: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.

6.en: Growing out of the bug’s back are mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms grow with the bug host.
6.ja: 虫の　背中に　生えているのは 冬虫夏草　という　キノコ。 育つと　キノコも　大きくなる。

7.en: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
7.ja: 喰っても　喰っても　背中に 生えている　キノコが　ほとんど 栄養を　奪っていくのだ。

8.en: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

1.en: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

2.en: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mush­ rooms on its back.

3.en: PARASECT is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.

4.en: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls PARASECT. It scatters poisonous spores.

5.en: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.

6.en: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
6.ja: 体よりも　大きな　キノコが パラセクトを　操っている。 毒の　胞子を　ばらまく。

7.en: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
7.ja: 大きな　キノコが　パラセクトを 操っている。　よく　マシェードと 縄張り争いを　している。

8.en: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.

1.en: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

2.en: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.

3.en: VENONAT is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even miniscule prey.

4.en: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

5.en: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

6.en: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
6.ja: 小さな　目が　たくさん　集まって 大きな　目に　なっている。 夜になると　明かりに　集まる。

7.en: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
7.ja: レーダーになる　大きな　目は 明るいところでは　小さな　目が 集まって　できているのが　わかる。

1.en: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

2.en: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poi­ sonous powder all around.

3.en: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

4.en: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

5.en: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

6.en: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
6.ja: ばらまかれた　りんぷんに　触れると 体の　感覚が　おかしくなって まっすぐ　立っていられなくなる。

7.en: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
7.ja: ハネの　りん粉は　体につくと なかなか　取れない。しかも　そこから 毒の　成分が　染み込んでくる。

1.en: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

2.en: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.

3.en: DIGLETT are raised in most farms. The reason is simple - wherever this POKéMON burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.

4.en: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.

5.en: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.

6.en: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
6.ja: 地下１メートルくらいを　掘りすすみ 木の根っこなどを　かじって　生きる。 たまに　地上に　顔を出す。

7.en: It chews on plant roots underground. Farmers whose vegetables are vulnerable find it can be quite a pest.
7.ja: 地下で　木の根を　かじる。　育てる 野菜の　品種に　よっては 農家に　害を　なす　ポケモン。

8.en: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
8.ja: ディグダが　通ったあとの　大地は ほどよく　耕されて 最高の　畑に　なる。

1.en: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

2.en: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

3.en: DUGTRIO are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.

4.en: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.

5.en: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.

6.en: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
6.ja: 地中を　掘りすすんで 相手が　油断しているところを 別の　場所から　攻撃する。

7.en: This set of triplets moves cooperatively. It’s the power of teamwork that enables this Pokémon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
7.ja: 三つ子が　協力し　行動。 地下１００キロを　掘り進むほどの パワーは　チームワークの　賜物。

8.en: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
8.ja: チームワークに　すぐれた　三つ子の ディグダ。　地下　１００キロまで 掘って　地震を　起こすこともある。

1.en: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

2.en: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.

3.en: MEOWTH withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this POKéMON loves shiny coins that glitter with light.

4.en: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

5.en: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

6.en: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
6.ja: 夜中に　行動する　習性。 キラキラ　光るものを　見つけると 負けないくらい　瞳が　輝く。

7.en: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.
7.ja: 昼間は　だらだら　寝て過ごし 日が　暮れるころに　活動開始。 夜の街で　コインを　探す。

8.en: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.
8.ja: 光り物を　集めるのが　好き。 機嫌が　いいときは　トレーナーにも コレクションを　見せてくれるぞ。

1.en: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

2.en: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.

3.en: PERSIAN has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers   sense air movements to determine what is in the POKéMON’s surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.

4.en: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

5.en: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

6.en: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
6.ja: 毛並みが　美しく ペットにしたがる　人も　多いが　すぐ ひっかいたり　するので　手強いぞ。

7.en: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.
7.ja: 気性が　荒く　目が　合うだけで 飛び掛ってくる。　鋭いツメに やられると　深い　傷を　負う。

8.en: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
8.ja: 気位が　高く　なつかせるのは たいへん。　気に食わない　ことが あると　すぐに　ツメを　立ててくる。

1.en: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.

2.en: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.

3.en: PSYDUCK uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this POKéMON  generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.

4.en: If its usual headache worsens, it starts exhibiting odd powers. It can’t remember doing so, however.

5.en: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.

6.en: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
6.ja: いつも　頭痛に　悩まされている。 この　頭痛が　激しくなると 不思議な　力を　使いはじめる。

7.en: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
7.ja: 自分の　意思とは　関係なく 時折　念力が　でてきて 頭が　痛くて　鳴いている。

8.en: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
8.ja: いつも　頭痛に　悩んでいる。 不思議な　力を　爆発させると しばらく　痛みは　治まるようだ。

1.en: Often seen swim­ ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

2.en: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its fore­ head somehow be­ gins to glow.

3.en: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of GOLDUCK give it frightening speed. This POKéMON is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.

4.en: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.

5.en: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

6.en: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
6.ja: 夕暮れ　水辺に　姿をみせる。 額が　あやしく　光るとき 神通力を　使いこなすという。

7.en: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
7.ja: 額の　赤い　部分を　持つと 神通力を　授かると　いわれ 乱獲　された　過去も　ある。

8.en: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
8.ja: 流れの　穏やかな　川に　棲む。 長い　手足で　水を　掻きわけ 優雅な　泳ぎを　みせる。

1.en: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

2.en: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.

3.en: When MANKEY starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.

4.en: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

5.en: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

6.en: It’s unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can’t distinguish friends from foes.
6.ja: 意味もなく　怒って　暴れ出すと 仲間の　区別も　つかなくなるので 近寄るのは　非常に　危険だ。

7.en: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
7.ja: 前触れもなく　突然　怒る。 暴れまくって　誰も　いなくなると 孤独に　耐えられなくて　また怒る。

1.en: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

2.en: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.

3.en: When PRIMEAPE becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.

4.en: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

5.en: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

6.en: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
6.ja: まわりに　だれも　いないときだけは 怒るのを　やめている。しかし それを　見るのは　難しい。

7.en: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
7.ja: あまりに　怒りすぎて　そのまま 死んでしまうことが　あるほどだが その死に顔は　とても　安らか。

1.en: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

2.en: It has a brave and trustworthy na­ ture. It fear­ lessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

3.en: GROWLITHE has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this POKéMON won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.

4.en: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

5.en: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

6.en: Very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.
6.ja: 人懐こく　誠実な　性格。 敵には　ほえて　かみつき 追い払おうとする。

7.en: It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
7.ja: 利口で　忠実。　ただし 見知らぬ者や　縄張りを　侵す 者には　吠えたてて　いかく　するぞ。

8.en: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
8.ja: 自分より　強くて　大きな　相手にも 恐れずに　立ち向かう 勇敢で　頼もしい　性格。

1.en: A POKéMON that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

2.en: This legendary Chinese POKEMON is considered magnif­ icent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

3.en: ARCANINE is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this POKéMON’s body is its source of power.

4.en: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

5.en: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

6.en: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
6.ja: 昔から　多くの　人を 虜にした　美しい　ポケモン。 飛ぶように　軽やかに　走る。

7.en: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokémon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.
7.ja: 東洋の　古い　言い伝え　にも 登場する。　威厳に　あふれ たくましくも　美しい　ポケモン。

8.en: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.
8.ja: 一昼夜で　１００００キロの 距離を　駆けぬける　姿は 多くの　人を　魅了してきた。

1.en: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

2.en: Because it is in­ ept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always  swims around in water.

3.en: POLIWAG has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the POKéMON’s spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.

4.en: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

5.en: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

6.en: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.
6.ja: スベスベした　黒い皮膚は　薄く 湿っている。内臓の　一部が 透けて　渦巻状に　見える。

7.en: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through. If the swirl is tinged white, that means it’s affected by some disease.
7.ja: 渦巻きは　透けて見える　内臓。 その色が　白みがかっているときは なにかの　病気に　かかっている。

8.en: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
8.ja: 歩くよりも　泳ぐほうが　得意。 お腹の　渦巻き模様は 透けて　見える　内臓の　一部だ。

1.en: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

2.en: The swirl on its belly subtly un­ dulates. Staring at it may gradual­ ly cause drowsi­ ness.

3.en: The surface of POLIWHIRL’s body is always wet and slick with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.

4.en: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

5.en: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

6.en: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.
6.ja: 陸でも　水中でも　暮らせる。 地上では　いつも　汗をかき 皮膚を　ぬめぬめ　させている。

7.en: Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
7.ja: 陸の上でも　普通に　暮らせるが 天敵の　ポケモンが　少ないので 水の　中の　生活を　好む。

8.en: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
8.ja: お腹の　渦は　ずっと　見ていると 眠くなる。　子守唄がわりに 子どもを　寝つかせるのにも　使う。

1.en: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

2.en: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.

3.en: POLIWRATH’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this POKéMON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.

4.en: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

5.en: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

6.en: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
6.ja: 強靭な　筋肉を　持つ。 太平洋を　休むことなく 泳ぎ続けることが　できるのだ。

7.en: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
7.ja: アローラの　ニョロボンは　平泳ぎが 得意。　ニョロボンの　マネで 泳ぎを　学ぶ　子どもも　多い。

8.en: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
8.ja: 全身が　筋肉の　塊。 寒い　海でも　たくましい　腕で 流氷を　砕き　突き進む。

1.en: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.

2.en: It senses impend­ ing attacks and TELEPORTS away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.

3.en: ABRA sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this POKéMON immediately teleports to safety.

4.en: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.

5.en: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.

6.en: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
6.ja: １日　１８時間は　寝ている。 眠ってる　あいだでも さまざまな　超能力を　使う。

7.en: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
7.ja: １日　１８時間は　眠る。 寝たまま　テレポートで　木の上に 移動し　木の実を　取って　喰う。

8.en: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
8.ja: 寝ながら　超能力を　操る。 夢の　内容が　使う　力に　影響する。

1.en: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

2.en: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.

3.en: KADABRA emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a TRAINER of this POKéMON.

4.en: If one is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens. Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck.

5.en: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.

6.en: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision devices.
6.ja: 超能力を　発揮すると 強い　アルファ波を　出して 精密機械を　壊してしまう。

7.en: A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young boy who couldn’t control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
7.ja: エスパー少年が　自分の　中の サイコパワーを　抑えきれなくなり 変身して　しまったとの　説も。

8.en: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
8.ja: サイコパワーで　宙に　浮いたまま 眠る。　弾力に　優れた　しっぽを 枕がわりに　するぞ。

1.en: Its brain can out­ perform a super­ computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

2.en: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.

3.en: ALAKAZAM’s brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This POKéMON holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.

4.en: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.

5.en: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.

6.en: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
6.ja: 脳細胞は　いつも　分裂して 死ぬまで　増え続けるので あらゆることを　覚えておける。

7.en: It is said to have an IQ of approximately 5,000. Its overflowing psychokinetic powers cause headaches to anyone nearby.
7.ja: 知能指数は　およそ　５０００。 強い　念力が　あふれだしており そばに　いるだけで　頭痛が　する。

8.en: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
8.ja: 非常に　高い　知能を　持つ。 生まれてから　死ぬまでの　できごとを すべて　覚えている　という。

1.en: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

2.en: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

3.en: MACHOP’s muscles are special - they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This POKéMON has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.

4.en: It hefts a GRAVELER repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.

5.en: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.

6.en: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
6.ja: ゴローンを　何度も　上げ下ろしして 全身の　筋肉を　鍛える。 あらゆる　格闘技を　使う。

7.en: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
7.ja: きたえるのが　大好き。　日に日に 膨れていく　筋肉を　ながめて ますます　トレーニングに　励むぞ。

8.en: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
8.ja: 全身が　筋肉になっており 子どもほどの　大きさしかないのに 大人　１００人を　投げ飛ばせる。

1.en: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

2.en: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable POKéMON never gets tired.

3.en: MACHOKE’s thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This POKéMON has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.

4.en: MACHOKE’s boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.

5.en: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.

6.en: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
6.ja: すごく　強靭な　肉体なので パワーセーブ　ベルトを　つけて 強さを　制御している。

7.en: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
7.ja: きたえにきたえた　結果　凄まじい パワーを　手にいれた。　その力を 活かし　人の仕事を　手伝う。

8.en: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
8.ja: すごく　強靭な　肉体なので パワーセーブ　ベルトを　つけて 強さを　制御している。

1.en: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

2.en: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

3.en: MACHAMP has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This POKéMON tends to leap into action before it thinks.

4.en: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.

5.en: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

6.en: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
6.ja: 発達した　４本の　腕は ２秒間に　１０００発の　パンチを 繰り出すことができる。

7.en: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
7.ja: メガトン級の　パンチを　放ち 立ちふさがる　敵を　地平線の 彼方まで　ぶっ飛ばすのだ。

8.en: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
8.ja: ４本の腕を　すばやく　動かし あらゆる　角度から　休むことなく パンチや　チョップを　叩きこむ。

1.en: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

2.en: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

3.en: BELLSPROUT’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this POKéMON spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

4.en: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

5.en: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

6.en: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
6.ja: ひょろっとした　体つきだが 獲物を　捕らえるときの　動きは 目にも　とまらないほど　素早い。

7.en: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
7.ja: 温度が　高く　湿度の　ある ところを　好む。ツルを　使って 小さなムシを　捕らえて　食べる。

1.en: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.

2.en: Even though it is filled with ACID, it does not melt because it also oozes a neutral­ izing fluid.

3.en: WEEPINBELL has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the POKéMON hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.

4.en: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

5.en: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

6.en: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
6.ja: 葉っぱの　部分は　カッターになって 相手を　切り裂く。口からは なんでも　溶かす　液体を　吐く。

7.en: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
7.ja: お腹が　減ると　手あたり次第に 動くものを　飲みこんでは 溶解液で　とどめを　さす。

1.en: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

2.en: ACID that has dis­ solved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.

3.en: VICTREEBEL has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this POKéMON swallows it whole.

4.en: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.

5.en: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.

6.en: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
6.ja: ジャングルの　奥地に　ウツボット ばかり　いる　地帯が　あって 行ったら　２度と　帰ってこれない。

7.en: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
7.ja: ミツの　香りで　獲物を　誘う。 口の中に　入れたものは　１日で ホネまで　溶かしてしまうという。

1.en: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

2.en: When the tide goes out, dehydrated TENTACOOL remains can be found washed up on the shore.

3.en: TENTACOOL’s body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this POKéMON happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.

4.en: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.

5.en: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.

6.en: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
6.ja: 体の　ほとんどが　水分。 水晶のような　目玉から 不思議な　ビームを　発射する。

7.en: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
7.ja: ビーチなどで　干からびているが まだ　生きていることも　多い。 水に　浸せば　ふやけて　復活。

8.en: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
8.ja: 泳ぐ　力は　強くは　ない。 浅い　海の　水面を 漂いながら　獲物を　探す。

1.en: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

2.en: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to CON­ STRICT its prey and enemies.

3.en: TENTACRUEL has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This POKéMON’s outburst creates rough waves around it.

4.en: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.

5.en: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.

6.en: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
6.ja: 触手は　普段　短くて 獲物を　刺すときに 長く　伸びて　絡みつくのだ。

7.en: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
7.ja: 毒の触手は　普通　８０本。 長く　生きているもの　ほど その　本数は　減っていく。

8.en: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
8.ja: 頭の　赤い　玉の　光が 強くなったら　要注意。 超音波を　放つ　前触れだ。

1.en: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

2.en: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many GEODUDE around.

3.en: The longer a GEODUDE lives, the more its edges are chipped and worn away, making it more rounded in appearance. However, this POKéMON’s heart will remain hard, craggy, and rough always.

4.en: Many live on mountain trails and remain half buried while keeping an eye on climbers.

5.en: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.

6.en: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
6.ja: 草原や　山に　生息する。 石ころに　似ていて　気がつかず 踏んだり　つまずいたりしてしまう。

7.en: Its round body makes it easy to pick up, but it is hard and heavy. It’s dangerous to play with them as if they were snowballs.
7.ja: 丸く　持ちやすいが　投げあうには 硬くて　重い。　雪玉の　ように ぶつけあって　遊ぶには　キケンだ。

8.en: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.

1.en: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

2.en: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

3.en: GRAVELER grows by feeding on rocks. Apparently, it prefers to eat rocks that are covered in moss. This POKéMON eats its way through a ton of rocks on a daily basis.

4.en: GRAVELER make their homes on sheer cliff faces by gouging out numerous horizontal holes.

5.en: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.

6.en: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn’t mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
6.ja: 山から　転がり　落ちるとき 体の　あちこちが　取れても 気にしない　豪快な　性格。

7.en: Mossy rocks are its favorite food. It can devour a ton a day while crunching loudly.
7.ja: コケの　ついた　岩が　大好物。 ボリボリと　音を　立てながら １日　１トン以上を　喰らう。

8.en: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.

1.en: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

2.en: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hard­ ens and crumbles away.

3.en: GOLEM live up on mountains. If there is a large earthquake, these POKéMON will come rolling down off the mountains en masse to the foothills below.

4.en: It sheds its hide once a year. Its boulderlike body is so tough, even dynamite can’t harm it.

5.en: Even dynamite can’t harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.

6.en: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
6.ja: 山頂から　ふもとまで　続く　溝は ゴローニャが　転がり落ちる 通り道なので　要注意。

7.en: Its body can survive dynamite blasts without a single scratch, but it hates rain and humidity.
7.ja: ダイナマイトで　爆破　しても 傷ひとつ　つかない　身体　だが 湿気や　雨は　大嫌い。

8.en: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.

1.en: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

2.en: It is a weak run­ ner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.

3.en: PONYTA is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This POKéMON becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
