4.en: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.

5.en: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

6.en: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
6.ja: 生まれたばかりでは　立つのがやっと。 だが　走るほどに　足腰は 鍛えられて　速度が　増していく。

7.en: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
7.ja: ものすごい　ジャンプの　後の 着地の　衝撃は　ヒヅメと 脚の　筋肉で　やわらげる。

8.en: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
8.ja: 生まれたばかりは　走るのが　へた。 仲間と　かけっこを　するうちに 足腰が　強く　育っていく。

1.en: Very competitive, this POKéMON will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

2.en: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredi­ bly fast.

3.en: RAPIDASH usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this POKéMON turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

4.en: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.

5.en: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.

6.en: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
6.ja: 速く　動く　物体を　見ると 競争したくなり　猛烈な スピードで　追いかけはじめる。

7.en: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
7.ja: とにかく　走るのが　大好きで 自分より　速いものを　見つけると 全速力で　追いかける。

8.en: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.
8.ja: 燃える　たてがみを　はためかせ 時速　２４０キロの　速度で 大草原を　駆けぬけるのだ。

1.en: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

2.en: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

3.en: SLOWPOKE uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this POKéMON often forgets what it’s doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water’s edge.

4.en: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

5.en: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

6.en: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
6.ja: いつも　ボーッとしていて　なにを 考えているか　わからない。 尻尾で　エサを　釣るのが　得意。

7.en: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn’t really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn’t particularly bothered.
7.ja: 長い　尻尾は　よく千切れる。 特に　痛みも　感じないし すぐに　生えるので　気にしない。

8.en: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.
8.ja: まぬけで　鈍感。　しっぽを 食べられても　痛みを　感じないし 生えかわったことにも　気づかない。

1.en: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.

2.en: If the tail-biting SHELLDER is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordi­ nary SLOWPOKE.

3.en: SLOWBRO’s tail has a SHELLDER firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This causes SLOWBRO to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.

4.en: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the SHELLDER on its tail bites down.

5.en: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.

6.en: An attached Shellder won’t let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
6.ja: くっついている　シェルダーは 尻尾から　にじみ出る　うま味が 欲しくて　ずっと　離れない。

7.en: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder’s poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
7.ja: 海を　眺め　ぼーっと　している。 シェルダーの毒が　身体に　回り より　ぼんやりするように　なった。

8.en: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
8.ja: シェルダーに　しっぽを　噛まれて 進化。　シェルダーは　しっぽから にじみ出る　甘味に　夢心地だ。

1.en: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.

2.en: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their POKéGEAR.

3.en: MAGNEMITE attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this POKéMON clinging to the breaker box.

4.en: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.

5.en: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.

6.en: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
6.ja: 左右の　ユニットから 重力を　さえぎる　力を 出すので　空中に　浮かべる。

7.en: It’s frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can’t stand.
7.ja: 電気が　ある　場所に　群れる。 電気を　送る　鉄塔　などに ビッシリと　張りついていることも。

8.en: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
8.ja: 体内の　電気が　切れて 地面に　転がっていることもある。 電池を　あげると　動きだすよ。

1.en: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

2.en: Three MAGNEMITE are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

3.en: MAGNETON emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this POKéMON.

4.en: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

5.en: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.

6.en: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
6.ja: 複数の　コイルが　連結して 強力な　磁力線と 高電圧を　放射する。

7.en: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
7.ja: 連結するとき　３匹のコイルの 脳も　一つに　連結する。 ３倍　賢くなりは　しない。

8.en: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
8.ja: ３匹の　コイルが　連結した。 強力な　電波を　放ち まわりの　様子を　観測する。

1.en: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

2.en: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.

3.en: FARFETCH’D is always seen with a stick from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good sticks and bad sticks. This POKéMON has been known to fight with others over sticks.

4.en: It can’t live without the stalk it holds. That’s why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

5.en: It can’t live without the stalk it holds. That’s why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

6.en: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
6.ja: 持っている　茎は　大切な 武器でもあり　刀を　振るように いろんな　ものを　切ることができる。

7.en: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetch’d are rarely seen, so it’s thought their numbers are decreasing.
7.ja: クキが　生えている　ところに　住む。 珍しく　数も　少ないので カモネギも　減ってきた　らしい。

8.en: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
8.ja: 羽で　もつ　茎を　刀のように 操り　敵を　切り捨てる。 いざと　いうときは　エサに　する。

1.en: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

2.en: By alternately raising and lower­ ing its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.

3.en: DODUO’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.

4.en: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

5.en: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

6.en: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
6.ja: 突然変異で　見つかった ２つの　頭を　持つ　ポケモン。 時速１００キロで　走る。

7.en: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
7.ja: 羽は　短く　空を飛ぶのは 苦手だが　その代わり　発達した 足で　速く　駆けることができる。

1.en: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

2.en: It collects data  and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and be­ come immobilized.

3.en: Watch out if DODRIO’s three heads are looking in three separate directions. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near this POKéMON if it’s being wary - it may decide to peck you.

4.en: When DODUO evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

5.en: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

6.en: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
6.ja: ３つの　頭が　見ている前で わずかでも　すきを　見せると クチバシで　激しく　つつかれる。

7.en: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
7.ja: ドードーの　どちらかの　頭が 分裂した　変種。草原を 時速　６０キロで　走っていく。

1.en: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

2.en: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It espe­ cially loves being in frigid seas.

3.en: SEEL hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.

4.en: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.

5.en: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.

6.en: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
6.ja: 氷山で　暮らす　ポケモン。 頭の　とがった　でっぱりで 氷を　割って　海を　泳ぐ。

7.en: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
7.ja: 冷たい　海にしか　棲まないと 考えられてきた。　アローラに 現れる　理由は　ナゾ。

1.en: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

2.en: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.

3.en: DEWGONG loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

4.en: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

5.en: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

6.en: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
6.ja: 全身が　真っ白な　毛で 覆われている。寒さに　強く むしろ　寒いほど　元気になる。

7.en: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.
7.ja: ８ノットの　速度で　海を　泳ぎ 獲物である　ポケモンを　探す。 特に　ヨワシが　大好物。

1.en: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

2.en: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new GRIMER emerge. This worsens the stench around it.

3.en: GRIMER’s sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any opening, however small it may be. This POKéMON enters sewer pipes to drink filthy wastewater.

4.en: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon’s X-rays. It appears among filth.

5.en: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon’s X-rays. It appears among filth.

6.en: Sludge exposed to X-rays from the moon transformed into Grimer. It loves feeding on filthy things.
6.ja: 月からの　エックス線を　浴びた ヘドロが　ベトベターに　変化した。 汚いものが　大好物。

7.en: Its main source of food is the slimy industrial waste of factories. This Pokémon’s numbers have been decreasing in recent years.
7.ja: 工場が　垂れ流す　ヘドロの 廃液が　主な　餌　なのだ。 最近は　数が　減ってきた。

1.en: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

2.en: They love to gath­ er in smelly areas where sludge ac­ cumulates, making the stench around them worse.

3.en: From MUK’s body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this POKéMON’s body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.

4.en: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.

5.en: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.

6.en: They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge accumulates, making the stench around them worse.
6.ja: ヘドロが　たまる　くさい　場所を 好んで　集まってくるので あたりは　いっそう　くさくなる。

7.en: The stench it gives off will make your nose scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think that’s a good thing.
7.ja: とにかく　鼻が　曲がるほど　臭い。 だが　一部には　それがいいと　いう ベトベトンマニアも　存在する。

1.en: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

2.en: It swims facing backward by open­ ing and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

3.en: At night, this POKéMON uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, SHELLDER closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.

4.en: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

5.en: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

6.en: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
6.ja: 硬い　殻は　どんな　攻撃も 跳ね返す。開いたときに 中を　攻撃されると　弱い。

7.en: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
7.ja: 殻の　硬度は　ダイヤモンドを 超える。　昔の人は　カラを 集めて　盾を　造っていた。

8.en: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
8.ja: ２枚の殻を　開けたり　閉じたり することで　後ろ向きに　泳ぐ。 そのスピードは　けっこう　速い。

1.en: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

2.en: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superi­ or strength.

3.en: CLOYSTER is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This POKéMON shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.

4.en: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

5.en: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

6.en: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
6.ja: 潮の　流れが　激しい　海に 生息している　パルシェンの 殻の　トゲは　大きく　鋭い。

7.en: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
7.ja: 硬い殻は　ナパーム弾　でも 砕けない。　カラの　中味の 正体は　未だ　不明。

8.en: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
8.ja: 殻が　非常に　硬く ナパーム弾でも　壊せない。 攻撃するときだけ　開く。

1.en: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

2.en: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

3.en: GASTLY is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this POKéMON cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.

4.en: This Pokémon’s body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.

5.en: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

6.en: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
6.ja: ガスでできた　薄い　体は どんな　大きさの　相手も 包みこみ　息の根を　止める。

7.en: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
7.ja: 廃墟に　なった　建物に 怪しい光が　灯っていたら そこに　ゴースが　潜んでいる。

8.en: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
8.ja: ガスから　生まれた　生命体。 毒を含んだ　ガスの　体に 包まれると　だれでも　気絶する。

1.en: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an­ other dimension.

2.en: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, HAUNTER lurks, silently stalking its next victim.

3.en: HAUNTER is a dangerous POKéMON. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This POKéMON will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.

4.en: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.

5.en: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

6.en: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
6.ja: 暗闇で　だれもいないのに 見られているような　気がしたら そこに　ゴーストが　いるのだ。

7.en: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
7.ja: 暗闇から　人間を　狙う。 冷たい　舌に　舐められると 日に日に　弱り　死に　至る。

8.en: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
8.ja: ガス状の　舌で　なめられると 体の　震えが　止まらなくなり やがては　死　に　いたるという。

1.en: Under a full moon, this POKéMON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

2.en: It steals heat from its surround­ ings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a GENGAR appeared.

3.en: Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a GENGAR running past you, pretending to be your shadow.

4.en: It hides in shadows. It is said that if GENGAR is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees F.

5.en: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.

6.en: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools the area by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
6.ja: 物陰に　姿を　隠す。 ゲンガーの　潜んでいる　部屋は 温度が　５度　下がるといわれる。

7.en: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
7.ja: 突然　寒気に　襲われたら ゲンガーに　狙われた　証拠。 逃げる術は　ないので　諦めろ。

8.en: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.
8.ja: 満月の夜　影が　勝手に 動きだして　笑うのは ゲンガーの　しわざに　違いない。

1.en: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

2.en: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.

3.en: ONIX has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this POKéMON does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.

4.en: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.

5.en: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.

6.en: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
6.ja: 地中を　ものすごい　勢いで 掘りすすみ　エサを　探す。通った 跡は　ディグダの　住処になる。

7.en: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
7.ja: 地中を　ものすごい　勢いで 掘り進み　エサを　探す。通った 跡は　ディグダの　住みかになる。

8.en: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
8.ja: 地中を　掘り進みながら いろんな　硬いものを　取り込み 頑丈な　体をつくる。

1.en: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

2.en: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a DROWZEE has probably eaten it.

3.en: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure sign that one of these POKéMON is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.

4.en: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

5.en: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

6.en: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
6.ja: 眠らせては　夢を　食べるが 悪い　夢ばかり　食べてると お腹を　壊すことが　あるらしい。

7.en: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
7.ja: 夢を　喰らって　生きる　ポケモン。 ムンナや　ムシャーナと　共通の 祖先を　持つと　考えられている。

1.en: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.

2.en: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.

3.en: HYPNO holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this POKéMON searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.

4.en: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

5.en: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

6.en: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
6.ja: 振り子のようなものを　持ち歩く。 子供に　催眠術を　かけて どこかへ　連れ去る　事件があった。

7.en: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
7.ja: 非常に　危険な　ポケモンだが 安眠を　求める　人々には 救世主と　呼ばれている。

1.en: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

2.en: If it senses dan­ ger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

3.en: KRABBY live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these POKéMON can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.

4.en: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.

5.en: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.

6.en: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
6.ja: 危険が　迫ると　口から　吐き出す 泡で　全身を　包んで 体を　大きく　みせようとする。

7.en: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
7.ja: 強力な　武器となる　ハサミは 攻撃のとき　まれに　もげるが 後から　すぐに　生えてくる。

8.en: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
8.ja: 海の　近くで　見つかる。 大きな　ハサミは　もぎとっても あとから　また　生えてくる。

1.en: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

2.en: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer's size makes it difficult to aim properly.

3.en: KINGLER has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the POKéMON quickly tires.

4.en: The larger pincer has 10,000- horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

5.en: The larger pincer has 10,000- horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

6.en: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
6.ja: 硬い　ハサミは　１万馬力の パワーを　持っているが 大きすぎて　動きが　鈍い。

7.en: One claw grew massively and is as hard as steel. It has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is too heavy.
7.ja: 片方だけ　巨大か　した ハサミは　鋼鉄の　硬さと １万馬力を　もつが　重すぎる。

8.en: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
8.ja: 硬い　ハサミは　１万馬力の パワーを　もっているが　大きすぎて 動きが　鈍い。

1.en: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL, they have zapped many people.

2.en: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

3.en: VOLTORB was first sighted at a company that manufactures POKé BALLS. The link between that sighting and the fact that this POKéMON looks very similar to a POKé BALL remains a mystery.

4.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

5.en: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

6.en: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.
6.ja: モンスターボールが　売り出されたのと 同じ　時期に　発見された。 なにか　関係があると　いわれる。

7.en: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
7.ja: モンスターボールに　似ているのは 保護色の　ためだと　言われるが 意外と　簡単に　自爆する。

8.en: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

1.en: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

2.en: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.

3.en: ELECTRODE eats electricity in the atmosphere. On days when lightning strikes, you can see this POKéMON exploding all over the place from eating too much electricity.

4.en: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

5.en: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

6.en: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of “The Bomb Ball.”
6.ja: 少しの　刺激に　反応して 爆発する。バクダンボールという あだ名で　怖がられている。

7.en: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.
7.ja: 少しでも　衝撃を　与えると 体内の　エレクトンエネルギーが あふれて　爆発　してしまう。

8.en: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

1.en: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

2.en: The shell is very durable. Even if it cracks, it can survive without spilling the contents.

3.en: This POKéMON consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, EXEGGCUTE is close to evolution.

4.en: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

5.en: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

6.en: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
6.ja: テレパシーで　会話をしているため タマタマを　引き離そうとしても すぐに　集まって　６匹になる。

7.en: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
7.ja: テレパシーで　仲間と　交信する。 植物と　ある種の　タイプの 遺伝子を　併せ持つと　いう。

8.en: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
8.ja: タマゴのように　見えるが　立派な ポケモン。　テレパシーで　仲間と 交信している　らしいぞ。

1.en: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.

2.en: Its three heads think independent­ ly. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.

3.en: EXEGGUTOR originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form EXEGGCUTE.

4.en: It is called “The Walking Jungle.” If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an EXEGGCUTE.

5.en: It is called “The Walking Jungle.” If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

6.en: Its three heads think independently. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.
6.ja: ３つの　頭は　考えることは 別々でも　仲良しなので ケンカしたり　しないらしい。

7.en: Each of its heads has its own will. They use telepathy to discuss their plans before coming to a joint decision.
7.ja: それぞれの　頭に　意思が　あり テレパシーで　話し合い　みんなで なにを　するのか　決めている。

8.en: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.
8.ja: ３つの　頭は　べつのことを 考えている。　自分以外は あまり　興味がない　ようだ。

1.en: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON's real face.

2.en: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes, and emits a plain­ tive and mournful sound.

3.en: CUBONE pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the POKéMON wears are made by the tears it sheds.

4.en: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

5.en: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

6.en: It wears the skull of its dead mother on its head. When it becomes lonesome, it is said to cry loudly.
6.ja: 死に別れた　母親の　骨を 頭に　覆っている。寂しいとき 大声で　泣くという。

7.en: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
7.ja: 死に別れた　母を　思いだして 大声で　泣く。　声を聞きつけた バルジーナに　空から　狙われる。

8.en: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
8.ja: 死に別れた　母親を　思い出し 泣くと　頭に　被った　骨の　中で 物悲しく　響くのだ。

1.en: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

2.en: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out mes­ sages to others.

3.en: MAROWAK is the evolved form of a CUBONE that has overcome its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This POKéMON’s tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.

4.en: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

5.en: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

6.en: It is small and was originally very weak. Its temperament turned ferocious when it began using bones.
6.ja: 体も　小さく　もともと　弱かった。 骨を　使うようになり 性格が　凶暴化した。

7.en: Originally, it was weak and timid. After evolution, its temperament becomes violent, and it begins to wield bones as weapons.
7.ja: 元々は　ひ弱で　おくびょう。 進化で　骨を　振り回す 乱暴な　性質に　なる。

8.en: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
8.ja: 悲しみを　乗りこえて　たくましく 進化した。　骨を　武器にして 勇敢に　敵と　渡り合う。

1.en: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

2.en: This amazing POKé­ MON has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

3.en: HITMONLEE’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.

4.en: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.

5.en: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.

6.en: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
6.ja: 脚が　自由に　伸び縮みして 遠く　離れている　場合でも 相手を　蹴り上げることができる。

7.en: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
7.ja: キックがあたる　瞬間！ 足のウラが　ダイヤモンドのように 硬くなって　相手を　破壊する。

8.en: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
8.ja: 見事な　バランス感覚。 どんな　姿勢でも　連続で キックを　放てる　すごい　やつ。

1.en: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

2.en: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

3.en: HITMONCHAN is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working towards a world championship. This POKéMON has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.

4.en: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

5.en: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

6.en: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
6.ja: 腕を　ねじりながら　繰り出す パンチは　コンクリートも　粉砕。 ３分　戦うと　ひとやすみする。

7.en: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall like a drill.
7.ja: ねじり込むような　パンチ攻撃！ コンクリートの壁が　ドリル状に 削られて　やがて　穴が　あく。

8.en: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
8.ja: 空気を　切り裂く　パンチ。 かすっただけで　火傷に　なるほど パンチの　スピードは　速いのだ。

1.en: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

2.en: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deft­ ly manipulated.

3.en: Whenever LICKITUNG comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.

4.en: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.

5.en: When it extends its over-six-foot- long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.

6.en: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
6.ja: 長い　舌は　ねばねばした だえきで　べっとり。どんなものでも くっついて　とても　便利。

7.en: It checks out whatever’s around it by licking everything. If you don’t clean off a spot where it’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!
7.ja: 長い　ベロで　なんでも　ベロリと 舐めて　確かめている。　舐められた 部分を　放っておくと　かぶれるぞ。

8.en: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
8.ja: ネバネバした　唾液に　触れたまま 放っておくと　ものすごい　痒みが はじまり　とまらなくなるぞ。

1.en: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

2.en: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

3.en: If KOFFING becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This POKéMON may also overinflate its round body, then explode.

4.en: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

5.en: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

6.en: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
6.ja: 薄い　バルーン状の　体に 猛毒の　ガスが　つまっている。 近くに　来ると　くさい。

7.en: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
7.ja: 暑いところ　では　体の中の ガスが　膨らんで　破裂する 危険性も　あるので　注意だ。

8.en: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
8.ja: 毒ガスで　パンパンの　体。 生ゴミの　腐った　においを 求め　ゴミ捨て場に　やってくる。

1.en: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.

2.en: If one of the twin KOFFING inflates, the other one deflates. It con­ stantly mixes its poisonous gases.

3.en: WEEZING loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage. This POKéMON will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will go through the trash.

4.en: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

5.en: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

6.en: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
6.ja: どちらかが　ふくらむと　片方は しぼむ　双子の　ドガース。いつも 体内の　毒ガスを　混ぜている。

7.en: This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.
7.ja: ゴミの中に　含まれている 毒ガス　バイ菌　ほこりを 吸収して　生きている。

8.en: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
8.ja: ２つの　体で　ガスを　混ぜる。 むかしの　ガラルでは　そこらじゅうで 姿を　見かけたらしい。

1.en: A POKéMON with a one-track mind. Once it charges,  it won't stop running until it falls asleep.

2.en: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.

3.en: RHYHORN runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This POKéMON may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.

4.en: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.

5.en: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.

6.en: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.
6.ja: 頭は　悪いが　力が　強く 高層ビルも　体当たりで コナゴナに　粉砕する。

7.en: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
7.ja: 単細胞で　一つの　ことしか 考えられない。突進を 始めると　眠るまで　止まらない。

8.en: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
8.ja: 頭は　悪いが　力が　強く 高層ビルも　体当たりで コナゴナに　粉砕する。

1.en: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

2.en: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.

3.en: RHYDON’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This POKéMON’s hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.

4.en: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.

5.en: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.

6.en: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
6.ja: 全身を　よろいのような　皮膚で 守っている。２０００度の マグマの　中でも　生きられる。

7.en: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
7.ja: 後ろ足だけで　歩くようになり 知能が　発達した。鎧の ような　皮膚は　マグマにも　耐える。

8.en: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
8.ja: 進化して　後ろ足だけで 立つようになった。　ツノで　突くと 岩石にも　穴を　開けてしまう。

1.en: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

2.en: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

3.en: CHANSEY lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.

4.en: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.

5.en: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

6.en: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
6.ja: 幸せを　運ぶと　いわれている。 傷ついた　人に　タマゴを 分けてあげる　優しい　ポケモン。

7.en: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
7.ja: ラッキーの　産む　タマゴは　栄養が たっぷり　つまっている。　多くの ポケモンが　大好物だ。

8.en: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
8.ja: タマゴは　栄養満点で　味も　抜群。 高級な　食材として　扱われる。

1.en: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea­ weed. Its vines shake as it walks.

2.en: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively un­ nerve its foes.

3.en: TANGELA’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.

4.en: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.

5.en: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.

6.en: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
6.ja: たくさんの　うごめく　ツルに 覆われて　正体不明。 青いツルは　一生　伸びる。

7.en: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
7.ja: 体が　青いツルに　覆われて 正体は　わからない。 ツルは　ずっと　伸び続けるという。

8.en: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
8.ja: ちぎれても　無限に　伸びる ツルの　奥の　正体は いまだ　解明されていない。

1.en: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

2.en: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.

3.en: If you come across a young KANGASKHAN playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby POKéMON’s parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.

4.en: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.

5.en: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.

6.en: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.
6.ja: お腹の　袋で　子育てをする。 安全な　ときだけ　子供を 袋から　出して　遊ばせる。

7.en: Kangaskhan’s maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.
7.ja: ガルーラの　母親の　愛情は 深い。　我が子を　守るためならば 死さえ　恐れないと　いわれている。

8.en: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
8.ja: 腹の　袋に　子どもが　いるが フットワークは　とても　軽い。 素早いジャブで　相手を　威嚇。

1.en: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

2.en: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its dorsal fin.

3.en: HORSEA eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this POKéMON anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.

4.en: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

5.en: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

6.en: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
6.ja: 水面から　勢いよく　墨を　発射して 飛んでいる　虫を 撃ち落とすことがあるという。

7.en: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
7.ja: 身に　危険を　感じたときは 口から　水や　特殊なスミを 勢いよく　吐き出す。

8.en: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
8.ja: 潮の　流れが　穏やかな　海に　棲む。 襲われると　真っ黒な　墨を吐いて その隙に　逃げだす。

1.en: Capable of swim­ ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

2.en: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.

3.en: SEADRA sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this POKéMON’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.

4.en: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

5.en: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

6.en: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
6.ja: うかつに　触ろうとすると 体中に　生える　トゲに　刺されて 気絶することもある。

7.en: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
7.ja: 背びれに　さわると　痺れてしまう。 眠るときは　流されないように シッポを　さんごに　巻きつける。

8.en: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
8.ja: オスが　子どもを　育てる。 子育て中は　背中の　トゲの　毒素が 強く　濃くなるのだ。

1.en: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

2.en: Its dorsal, pecto­ ral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.

3.en: GOLDEEN is a very beautiful POKéMON with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this POKéMON - it could ram you powerfully with its horn.

4.en: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail fin as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.

5.en: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.

6.en: It swims at a steady 5 knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
6.ja: ５ノットの　スピードで　泳ぐ。 身の　危険を　感じると 鋭い　ツノで　反撃する。

7.en: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
7.ja: 暖かくなってくると　群れをなし 川を　さかのぼる。　その光景は 春を　告げる　風物詩だ。

8.en: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
8.ja: 背びれ　胸びれ　尾びれが 優雅に　たなびくので 水の踊り子　と呼ばれる。

1.en: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming power­ fully up rivers and creeks.

2.en: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, coloring the rivers a brilliant red.

3.en: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

4.en: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.

5.en: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

6.en: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
6.ja: 秋が　くると　産卵のために 流れに　逆らって　力強く 川を　泳ぐ　姿が　みられる。

7.en: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
7.ja: 肌寒くなるころ　全身が 紅に　染まる。　その姿は 秋を　感じる　風物詩だ。

8.en: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
8.ja: 秋になると　プロポーズのため 体に　脂が　のってきて とても　きれいな色に　変化する。

1.en: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

2.en: At night, the cen­ ter of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.

3.en: STARYU’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these POKéMON look like the stars in the sky.

4.en: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

5.en: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

6.en: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
6.ja: 体の　中心で　光る コアが　ある限り 体が　ちぎれても　再生できる。

7.en: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
7.ja: 海辺に　多く　生息。 夜に　なると　身体の　中心が 怪しく　赤く　輝きだす。

8.en: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
8.ja: 夏の終わりの　浜辺に　行くと 規則的な　リズムで　光る ヒトデマンの　群れが　見られるよ。

1.en: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

2.en: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a dif­ ferent color each time it is seen.

3.en: STARMIE’s center section - the core - glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this POKéMON has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”

4.en: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

5.en: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

6.en: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
6.ja: 真ん中の　コアと呼ばれる　部分は 七色に　輝く。これを 宝石にする　人も　いるという。

7.en: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
7.ja: 輝く　コアから　謎の　電波を 送受信　していると　いう。 近づくと　頭痛が　することも。

8.en: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
8.ja: 強烈な　サイコパワーを　放つとき コアと　呼ばれる　器官が 七色に　きらめく。

1.en: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

2.en: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisi­ ble objects as it matures.

3.en: MR. MIME is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once it is believed, it will exist as if it were a real thing.

4.en: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.

5.en: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.

6.en: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
6.ja: 指先から　出す　波動が 空気を　固めて　壁を　作る。 激しい　攻撃も　跳ね返す。

7.en: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
7.ja: 素晴らしい　パントマイムの　腕前。 見とれている　間に　いつの間にか 本当に　壁が　できているのだ。

8.en: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
8.ja: 大きな　手のひらは　パントマイムを するために　発達　したと 考える　学者も　多い。

1.en: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

2.en: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

3.en: SCYTHER is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This POKéMON’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.

4.en: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja’s.

5.en: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

6.en: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
6.ja: 鋭い　カマで　獲物を　切り裂き 息の根を　止める。ごくまれに 羽を　使って　飛ぶ。

7.en: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
7.ja: ニンジャのように　素早い　動きで 獲物を　惑わせる。　一瞬の 隙に　鎌で　切り裂いて　しまう。

8.en: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
8.ja: 戦いを　重ねるごとに　鎌の 切れ味は　上がる。 大木も　一刀両断に　切り裂くぞ。

1.en: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

2.en: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depend­ ing on how it is feeling.

3.en: JYNX walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.

4.en: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

5.en: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

6.en: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
6.ja: 腰を　振るように　歩いている。 油断をすると　思わず　釣られて 踊ってしまうという。

7.en: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.
7.ja: 独特の　リズムで　腰を　振る。 アローラに　棲む　ルージュラは そのキレが　実に　素晴らしい。

8.en: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
8.ja: ガラルの　とある　地域では 氷の　女王と　呼んで ルージュラを　恐れ崇めていた。

1.en: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

2.en: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its en­ tire body glows a whitish-blue.

3.en: When a storm arrives, gangs of this POKéMON compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of lightning rods.

4.en: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.

5.en: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.

6.en: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish blue.
6.ja: 体の　表面には　電気が 流れている。あたりが　暗いと 全身が　青白く　光るのだ。

7.en: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
7.ja: 突然起こる　停電の　半分は エレブーが　発電所に　集まり 電気を　喰い散らかした　からだ。

8.en: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
8.ja: 電気を　狙う　エレブーの　対策に じめんポケモンを　置く 発電所は　多い。

1.en: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

2.en: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suit­ able for itself.

3.en: In battle, MAGMAR blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This POKéMON’s fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.

4.en: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.

5.en: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.

6.en: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
6.ja: 火山の　火口近くで　見つかった。 口から　炎を　吐く。 体温は　１２００度もある。

7.en: When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
7.ja: 疲れると　火口に　飛び込み マグマに　浸かって　体を　癒す。 全身が　１２００度で　燃えている。

8.en: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
8.ja: 炎で　獲物を　しとめる。 ついつい　焼きすぎて 黒コゲに　してしまい　後悔する。

1.en: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

2.en: With its horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.

3.en: PINSIR is astoundingly strong. It can grip a foe weighing twice its weight in its horns and easily lift it. This POKéMON’s movements turn sluggish in cold places.

4.en: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.

5.en: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.

6.en: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.
6.ja: ２本の　ツノで　獲物を　挟んで ちぎれるまで　放さない。ちぎれない ときは　かなたまで　投げ飛ばすのだ。

7.en: It grips its prey in its pincers and splits them apart. Although it is a powerful Pokémon, it can’t deal with the cold.
7.ja: 長い　角で　相手を　挟み込み そのまま　真っ二つに　してしまう。 パワフルだが　寒いのは　苦手。

8.en: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
8.ja: ツノで　互いを　格付けする。 太く　立派な　ツノを　持つ カイロスほど　異性に　人気。

1.en: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

2.en: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd's protector takes pride in its bat­ tle-scarred horns.

3.en: This POKéMON is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for TAUROS to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.

4.en: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.

5.en: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.

6.en: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
6.ja: ３本の　尻尾で　自分を　たたき 戦う　気持ちを　高めると 全速力で　突っこんでくる。

7.en: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
7.ja: 世界の　各地に　ケンタロスに　乗り 生活　してきた　歴史が　あるが その始まりは　アローラ　だという。

8.en: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
8.ja: しっぽで　自分の　体を 叩きだしたら　危険だぞ。 猛スピードで　突っ込んでくる。

1.en: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

2.en: An underpowered, pathetic POKéMON. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.

3.en: MAGIKARP is a pathetic excuse for a POKéMON that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.

4.en: It is said to be the world’s weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.

5.en: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

6.en: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
6.ja: 力も　スピードも　ほとんど　ダメ。 世界で　一番　弱くて 情けない　ポケモンだ。

7.en: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you’ll soon grow tired of seeing them.
7.ja: 力は　弱く　頼りないのに 繁殖力だけ　物凄い。 飽きるほど　みかけるぞ。

8.en: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
8.ja: 力も　スピードも　ほとんどダメ。 世界で　一番　弱くて 情けない　ポケモンだ。

1.en: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

2.en: They say that during past wars, GYARADOS would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.

3.en: When MAGIKARP evolves into GYARADOS, its brain cells undergo a structural transformation. It is said that this transformation is to blame for this POKéMON’s wildly violent nature.

4.en: Once it begins to rampage, a GYARADOS will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

5.en: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

6.en: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
6.ja: 争いの　起こった　村を 焼きつくしたという　記録が 古文書に　残されている。

7.en: A tale is told of a town that angered Gyarados. Before the sun rose the next day, flames utterly consumed the town, leaving not a trace behind.
7.ja: ギャラドスを　怒らせた　ある街は 一晩の　うちに　焼き尽くされ 跡形も　なくなったと　いわれる。

8.en: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
8.ja: 非常に　狂暴な　性格。 口から出す　破壊光線は すべてのものを　焼きつくす。

1.en: A POKéMON that has been over­ hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

2.en: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their num­ ber has dwindled.

3.en: People have driven LAPRAS almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this POKéMON is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.

4.en: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

5.en: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

6.en: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
6.ja: 優しい　心の　持ち主。 めったに　争わないため　たくさん 捕まえられ　数が　減った。

7.en: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When it’s in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
7.ja: 高い　知能を　持ち　人間の 言葉を　理解する。　ご機嫌に なると　美しい　声で　歌う。

8.en: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
8.ja: 賢く　心優しい　ポケモン。 きれいな　歌声を　響かせながら 海の上を　泳いで　いく。

1.en: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

2.en: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.

3.en: DITTO rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this POKéMON manages to get details wrong.

4.en: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

5.en: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

6.en: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
6.ja: 全身の　細胞を　組み替えて 見たものの　形　そっくりに 変身する　能力を　持つ。

7.en: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
7.ja: 細胞を　組み替え　みた　相手 そっくりに　姿を　変化させる。 再現度は　個体に　よる。

8.en: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
8.ja: 全身の　細胞を　組み替えて 見たもの　そっくりに　変身するが 力が　抜けると　もとにもどる。

1.en: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs.

2.en: It has the ability to alter the com­ position of its body to suit its surrounding envi­ ronment.

3.en: EEVEE has an unstable genetic makeup that suddenly mutates due to the environment in which it lives. Radiation from various STONES causes this POKéMON to evolve.

4.en: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.

5.en: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

6.en: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.
6.ja: 進化のとき　姿と　能力が 変わることで　きびしい　環境に 対応する　珍しい　ポケモン。

7.en: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.
7.ja: アンバランス　かつ　不安定な 遺伝子を　持っており　様々な 進化の　可能性を　秘めている。

8.en: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.
8.ja: まわりの　環境に　合わせて 体の　つくりを　変えていく 能力の　持ち主。

1.en: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

2.en: When VAPOREON's fins begin to vi­ brate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

3.en: VAPOREON underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This POKéMON has the ability to freely control water.

4.en: It has evolved to be suitable for an aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.

5.en: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can melt away into water.

6.en: It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water.
6.ja: きれいな　水辺を　好んでいる。 細胞が　水の　分子に　似ており 水に　溶けることもできる。

7.en: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
7.ja: 細胞構造が　水の　分子に よく　似ている。　水辺に　棲むので 人魚に　間違われることも。

8.en: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
8.ja: シャワーズの　全身の　ひれが 小刻みに　震えはじめるのは 数時間後に　雨が降る　しるし。

1.en: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts.

2.en: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

3.en: JOLTEON’s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the POKéMON to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.

4.en: It controls 10,000-volt power and can raise all the fur on its body as if it were sharp needles.

5.en: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.

6.en: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
6.ja: 体内に　電気が　たまると 全身の　体毛が　全部 鋭く　とがりはじめる。

7.en: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
7.ja: 約１００００ボルトの　電気を 吐き出す。　かなり　神経質で なつかせるのは　大変だ。

8.en: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
8.ja: 怒ったり　驚いたりすると 全身の　毛が　針の　ように 逆立って　相手を　つらぬく。

1.en: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

2.en: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees.

3.en: FLAREON’s fluffy fur has a functional purpose - it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This POKéMON’s body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees F.

4.en: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.

5.en: Inhaled air is heated in the flame sac in its body to an intense fire over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

6.en: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.
6.ja: 体内に　炎袋を　持つ。 戦いが　はじまる　直前には 体温が　９００度まで　上がる。

7.en: When it catches prey or finds berries, it breathes fire on them until they’re well done, and then it gobbles them up.
7.ja: 木の実や　獲物を　捕まえると 炎を　吹いて　ウェルダンぐらいに なるまで　焼きあげてから　ガブリ。

8.en: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
8.ja: 体内に　炎が　溜まると ブースターの　体温も　最高 ９００度　まで　上がっていく。

1.en: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

2.en: It is a manmade POKéMON. Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.

3.en: PORYGON is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This POKéMON is copy-protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.

4.en: The world’s first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.

5.en: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.

6.en: A man-made Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
6.ja: 研究の末　生み出された 人工の　ポケモン。基本的な 動作しか　プログラムされていない。

7.en: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
7.ja: およそ　２０年前に　当時の 科学力を　結集し 生みだされた　人工の　ポケモン。

8.en: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
8.ja: 最高の　科学力を　使い 世界で　はじめて　プログラムにより 作られた　人工の　ポケモン。

1.en: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

2.en: Revived from an ancient fossil, this POKéMON uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.

3.en: OMANYTE is one of the ancient and long- since-extinct POKéMON that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.

4.en: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

5.en: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

6.en: A prehistoric Pokémon that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
6.ja: 大昔　海に　住んでいた 古代ポケモン。１０本の　脚を くねらせて　泳ぐ。

7.en: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its fossils have been found bearing bite marks from Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.
7.ja: 古代の海に　生きていた　ポケモン。 アーケオスの　エサだったようで 歯型のついた　化石が　見つかる。

8.en: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
8.ja: 復元されたあと　逃げだしたり 逃がしてしまう　ものが　いるため 問題に　なりつつあるのだ。

1.en: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

2.en: Apparently, it cracked SHELLDER's shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.

3.en: OMASTAR uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.

4.en: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

5.en: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

6.en: Its tentacles are highly developed as if they are hands and feet. As soon as it ensnares prey, it bites.
6.ja: 触手が　手足のように 発達している。しがみつくと 同時に　かみついてくる。

7.en: Its heavy shell is thought to be the reason this ancient Pokémon died out. It’s apparently a distant ancestor of Octillery.
7.ja: 重いカラが　原因で　滅んだと 考えられている　古代ポケモン。 オクタンの　遠い　祖先　らしい。

8.en: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
8.ja: 大きく　重い　殻のせいで 動きが　鈍くなり　獲物を　獲れずに 絶滅した　という。

1.en: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

2.en: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.

3.en: KABUTO is a POKéMON that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The POKéMON has not changed at all for 300 million years.

4.en: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.

5.en: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.

6.en: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
6.ja: ３億年前の　砂浜で 暮らしていたと　考えられている。 硬い　殻が　身を　守る。

7.en: This Pokémon thrived 300 million years ago. It’s said that living specimens can still be seen in a certain region—a rare sight.
7.ja: ３億年前に　栄えた　ポケモン。 とある　地方では　今でも　まれに 生きた　姿が　見られると　言う。

8.en: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
8.ja: ほぼ　全滅した　ポケモン。 ３日に　一度　脱皮して 殻を　どんどん　硬くする。

1.en: Its sleek shape is perfect for swim­ ming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

2.en: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.

3.en: KABUTOPS swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The POKéMON was apparently evolving from being a water-dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.

4.en: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

5.en: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

6.en: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
6.ja: 水中を　移動するとき 手足を　小さく　折りたたみ 甲羅を　くねらせ　速く　泳ぐ。

7.en: Its body had begun to change so it could function on land. But it didn’t adapt in time and went extinct.
7.ja: 陸でも　活動　できるよう 身体が　変化を　始めていたが 間に合わず　絶滅　してしまった。

8.en: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.
8.ja: 獲物を　切り裂き　体液を　すする。 残った　体は ほかのポケモンの　エサになる。

1.en: A ferocious, pre­ historic POKéMON that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

2.en: A vicious POKéMON from the distant past, it appears to have flown by spreading its wings and gliding.

3.en: AERODACTYL is a POKéMON from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.

4.en: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

5.en: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

6.en: It was regenerated from a dinosaur’s genetic matter that was found in amber. It flies with high-pitched cries.
6.ja: こはくに　残された　恐竜の 遺伝子から　復活させた。 高い　声で　鳴きながら　飛ぶ。

7.en: A Pokémon from the age of the dinosaurs. It used its sawlike fangs to shred its prey before eating them.
7.ja: 恐竜　時代の　ポケモン。 のこぎりのような　キバで　獲物を 引き裂いて　喰っていた。

8.en: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
8.ja: 古代の　獰猛な　ポケモン。 完璧な　復元は いまの　科学でも　不可能らしい。

1.en: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

2.en: What sounds like its cry may ac­ tually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.

3.en: SNORLAX’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile POKéMON that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.

4.en: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.

5.en: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

6.en: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
6.ja: １日に　食べ物を　４００キロ 食べないと　気がすまない。 食べ終わると　眠ってしまう。

7.en: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk’s poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax’s tongue.
7.ja: 最強の　胃袋を　持つと いわれる。　ベトベトンの　毒でさえ カビゴンの　舌には　スパイスなのだ。

8.en: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
8.ja: １日に　食べ物を　４００キロ 食べないと　気がすまない。 食べ終わると　眠ってしまう。

1.en: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

2.en: The magnificent, seemingly translu­ cent wings of this legendary bird POKéMON are said to be made of ice.

3.en: ARTICUNO is a legendary bird POKéMON that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this POKéMON flies, snow will fall.

4.en: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

5.en: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

6.en: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.
6.ja: 伝説の　とりポケモン。 空気中の　水分を　凍らせ 吹雪を　作り出すことが　できる。

7.en: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.
7.ja: 冬空の　空気に　含まれる 水分を　凍らせて　雪を 降らせる　伝説の　鳥ポケモン。

8.en: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
8.ja: 青く　美しい　羽根は　氷で できていると　言われている。　長い 尾を　たなびかせ　雪山を　飛ぶ。

1.en: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

2.en: This legendary bird POKéMON causes savage thunderstorms by flapping its glit­ tering wings.

3.en: ZAPDOS is a legendary bird POKéMON that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The POKéMON gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

4.en: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

5.en: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

6.en: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.
6.ja: 雲の　上から　巨大な　稲妻を 落としながら　現れる 伝説の　とりポケモンである。

7.en: This legendary bird Pokémon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.
7.ja: 空が　暗くなり　稲妻が 連続して　落ちていく　果てに 伝説の　ポケモンは　現れる。

8.en: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
8.ja: 電気を　自在に　操る。 真っ黒な　雷雲の　中に 巣があると　言い伝えられている。

1.en: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

2.en: This legendary POKéMON scatters embers with every flap of its wings. It is a thrilling sight to behold.

3.en: MOLTRES is a legendary bird POKéMON that has the ability to control fire. If this POKéMON is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

4.en: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

5.en: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

6.en: It is said to be the legendary bird Pokémon of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flare of flames.
6.ja: 昔から　火の鳥伝説として 知られる。羽ばたくたびに　羽が 明るく　燃え上がり　美しい。

7.en: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.
7.ja: 夜空　さえも　赤く　するほど 激しく　燃え上がる　翼で 羽ばたく　伝説の　鳥ポケモン。

8.en: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
8.ja: 羽ばたくと　翼の　炎が 赤く　美しく　きらめく 伝説の　鳥ポケモンの　１匹。

1.en: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

2.en: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.

3.en: DRATINI continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.

4.en: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

5.en: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

6.en: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
6.ja: 目撃者が　少ないために 幻のポケモンと　呼ばれていた。 脱皮した　皮が　見つかっている。

7.en: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
7.ja: 脱皮を　繰り返し　大きくなる。 抜け殻を　なめして　つくった ブーツは　超高級品。

8.en: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
8.ja: 滝つぼなど　流れの　激しい 水辺で　暮らしている。　脱皮を 繰り返して　大きく　育つ。

1.en: A mystical POKéMON that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

2.en: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

3.en: DRAGONAIR stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.

4.en: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

5.en: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

6.en: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.
6.ja: 水晶のような　玉には 天候を　自由に　操る 能力が　秘められているらしい。

7.en: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.
7.ja: 水晶の　ような　玉には 天候を　操る　パワーが 秘められていると　いわれている。

8.en: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
8.ja: 尻尾の　玉に　力を　集めて 天候を　操る。 オーラを　まとう　姿は　神秘的。

1.en: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

2.en: It is said that this POKéMON con­ stantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drown­ ing people.

3.en: DRAGONITE is capable of circling the globe in just sixteen hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.

4.en: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

5.en: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

6.en: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
6.ja: 大きな　体格で　空を　飛ぶ。 地球を　約１６時間で １周してしまう。

7.en: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
7.ja: 遭難した　男が　助けられ 連れて行かれた　孤島　は カイリューだけの　楽園だった。

8.en: It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.
8.ja: 溺れている　人や　ポケモンを 見つけると　助けずには　いられない 心優しい　ポケモン。

1.en: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

2.en: Because its battle abilities were raised to the ultimate level, it thinks only of de­ feating its foes.

3.en: MEWTWO is a POKéMON that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this POKéMON’s body, they failed to endow MEWTWO with a compassionate heart.

4.en: A Pokémon created by recombining MEW’s genes. It’s said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

5.en: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew’s genes. It’s said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

6.en: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.
6.ja: １人の　科学者が　何年も 恐ろしい　遺伝子　研究を 続けた　結果　誕生した。

7.en: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
7.ja: ミュウの　遺伝子と　ほとんど 同じ。だが　大きさも　性格も 恐ろしいほど　違っている。

1.en: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.

2.en: Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.

3.en: MEW is said to possess the genetic composition of all POKéMON. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

4.en: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe MEW to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

5.en: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

6.en: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.
6.ja: あらゆる　技を　使うため ポケモンの　先祖と　考える 学者が　たくさん　いる。

7.en: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
7.ja: 顕微鏡で　覗いてみたら 非常に　短くて　細い こまやかな　体毛が　生えていた。
